The tent protected us from the worst of the weather.

senses.definition: a report of what the weather will be like, on the radio or television, in the newspapers or online

examples.x: to listen to/watch the weather
And now for the weather.
I checked the weather this morning.

senses.definition: a description, for example on the radio or television, of what the weather will be like tomorrow or for the next few days

examples.x: There’s a good weather forecast for tomorrow.
Check the internet for the latest weather forecast.

senses.definition: a woman on radio or television whose job is describing the weather and telling people what it is going to be like
a newspaper or magazine that is published every week

examples.x: Most people launching weeklies were already weekly publishers.
Men’s weeklies are currently enjoying a growth in readership.

senses.definition: noise that contains many different sound frequencies that are equally strong, for example the noise that comes from a television or radio that is turned on but not tuned in
a way of presenting a film in which the image is a lot wider than it is high Widescreen

examples.x: a widescreen TV

senses.definition: any system of sending electronic information, such as the internet, phone signals, etc. without using wires for the receiving equipment

examples.x: a message sent by wireless
a wireless operator

senses.definition: a radio

examples.x: I heard it on the wireless.

senses.definition: an organization that supplies news to newspapers and to radio and television stations
an article in a newspaper or magazine in which somebody writes what they think about a new book, play, product, etc.

examples.x: The performance got a good write-up in the local press.

senses.definition: newspaper reports that are exaggerated and written to shock readers
to destroy, kill or hit somebody/something suddenly and with force

examples.x: The monster got zapped by a flying saucer (= in a computer game).
It's vital to zap stress fast.
He jumped like a man who'd been zapped with 1 000 volts.

senses.definition: to do something very fast

examples.x: I'm zapping through (= reading very fast) some modern novels at the moment.

senses.definition: to use the remote control to change television channels quickly
to move, or make somebody/something move, very fast in the direction mentioned

examples.x: The racing cars zapped past us.
